summary:
Me,  a stoner nerd at work: let’s create a new Star Wars ship
My brain: it has to be bold, it has to be controversial, it has to...
body:
Me, a stoner nerd at work: let’s create a new Star Wars ship

My brain: it has to be bold, it has to be controversial, it has to shake these nerds to their cores! 😈

Me: what about… an AU where Anakin loves Sand?

Brain: I mean it DOES get everywhere 🤔

Me: that’s what I was thinking!

Me and Brain: You’re a genius!!! 👌🏾😭✌🏾

summary: People are mad about the Waffle House Reylo fic because it's literally pedophilia.
question: People are mad about the Waffle House Reylo fic because it's literally pedophilia.
answer: I don’t know the context of the whole fic thing. To my knowledge it was because Waffle House tweeted something endorsing the reylos and a lot of people got mad over a company being engaging about that pairing that tumblr seems to hate passionately, which I don’t really understand because I’ve seen so many ships here that don’t make sense and are way worse. My stance on reylo is if you ship it good and if you don’t also good.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

blog.name: superheroesincolor
blog.title: Superheroes In Full Color
blog.description: This blog is dedicated to Racial and cultural diversity in comic books and derivative works (film, tv, videogames)

summary: Star Wars: Age Of The Republic - Jango Fett #1    THE MOST FEARED BOUNTY HUNTER IN THE GALAXY! JANGO FETT’S reputation precedes...
caption:
Star Wars: Age Of The Republic - Jango Fett #1   

THE MOST FEARED BOUNTY HUNTER IN THE GALAXY! JANGO FETT’S reputation precedes him as joins a crew for what seems like a simple job. Wait, is that a KID with him?! Will his fellow bounty hunters be foolish enough to betray Jango and his son, BOBA FETT?

Story: Jody Houser, art: Luke Ross

Get the comics here

[ Follow SuperheroesInColor on facebook / instagram / twitter / tumblr ]

blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

summary: Old and Sweet- Obi and Ben talk.  Ani finally comes clean.  Palpatine is lurking.
question: Old and Sweet- Obi and Ben talk.  Ani finally comes clean.  Palpatine is lurking.
answer:
Handing the other the cooled cup, Obi-Wan smiled slightly. “You should have gone for the less spicy option Ben.” He chuckled quietly as the older man gave him a meek look with a whine as he sipped slowly at the fizzy drink.

“Thank you for the fizzy lemon,” Ben mumbled out, taking the smallest of sips. “And yes, but it tasted so good.” The older man whimpered a bit, rubbing his stomach gingerly.

“Remind me not to make any of the spicy Tatooine dishes for you Ben,” Anakin chuckled quietly, wiping his hands clean of droid oil as R2 whirled happily after having his insides oiled and cleaned by Anakin. “You might get a heartburn or even an ulcer on top of indigestion.” He chuckled quietly as Obi-Wan sat down.

“Ulcers are bad.” Ben whined a bit louder, settling his head down on Obi-Wan’s shoulder.

The two healthy Jedi traded glances at that, understanding that Ben was implying that he had ulcers at one point.

Glancing at R2 as he chirped about 3CPO, Anakin hesitated a bit before sighing and flinging his rag at the table and sitting back in his recliner. “I’m married to Padme.” He said quickly, the words almost stumbling in his mouth and coming out wrong.

Obi-Wan paused, his fingers in Ben’s hair as the older man continued drinking his fizzy lemon water slowly. “Well yes you are… oh right I’m suppose to behave with shock right now right?” He blinked before shaking his head. “I’m sorry but after everything that’s been happening lately I’ve fresh out of pretend shock and gasps.” He chuckled.

Opening his mouth and closing it, Anakin settled on tiredly shrugging.

Obi-Wan wasn’t exactly wrong, so much had happened that they were a bit out of emotions to be honest.

Shifting in his seat, Anakin glanced at R2 again before humming. “Padme told me to extend a dinner invitation the day I finally fessed up, so um… wanna come to dinner at her apartment? She said something about keeping a celebratory wine that’s years old from Naboo.”

Chuckling once more, Obi-Wan nodded. “That does sound lovely but don’t you have to tell he-”

“R2 buddy?” Anakin tilted his head at the astromech. “Send a message to Padme and tell her we’ll have two dinner guests and to pop the Nabooan wine?” He smirked wryly as the droid chirped shrilly before flopping his head in Obi-Wan’s direction and wiggling his brows.

Smirking amusedly in return, Obi-Wan continued petting Ben’s hair. “Well alright but if you intend for us to bring Ben then keep his indigestion in mind, he can’t eat just anything and Nabooan cuisine can be rather sugary and buttery.” He cautioned the other.

()()()

Watching the three Jedi enter Amidala’s apartment, Sheev pursed his lips while tapping his hand on the arm of the chair. The surveillance system he had installed was working quite effectively but what he was seeing…

‘So Skywalker finally told Kenobi…’ He growled quietly to himself. ‘The old one has got to go. He’s clearly part of why Skywalker has become stable.

Standing, Sheev moved to the hidden communication room with the secured lines.

He needed the problem taken care of and Tyrannus little Dathomiria assassin would be very useful for such a thing. She may not be able to get Kenobi out of the way but an older Kenobi without the ability to move so well…

No even she could be that incompetent.

summary: God of War and Star Wars
title: God of War and Star Wars
body:
The two original Star Wars trilogies were about the Skywalker family. Their relationships, their mistakes, the tormenting past and their eventual redemption. In this sense, God of War is like Star Wars with mythological gods.

That is something positive. Human fictions that resist time are precisely those that touched us, those that excite us, after all, the intellectual capacity, together with that of understanding our feelings, is what sets us apart from our younger animal brothers.

Many stories follow a similar archetype, but archetypes exist precisely because we empathize with them, we are moved by the story of the characters. If we would analyze the earliest origins of this type of story, we will discover, in the midst of fiction, at least a little truth, real facts arising from life.

The creative director of the latest God of War, Cory Barlog, said he was influenced by a canceled TV series of Star Wars when creating the latest God of War. The series would show how the Emperor became the villain. Barlog was the lead animator on the first God of War and the director for God of War II. He started as the director of God of War III, but left developer Sony Santa Monica during its development. In 2009, he worked briefly at the now closed LucasArts, which is when he got in touch with the TV series.

The latest God of War focuses more on human relations than in the past, since the previous games of the series were limited to kill everything while Kratos continuously shouts. Although he was an absent father, he must now take care of his son, raised practically alone by his mother. Kratos is rethinking his life, trying to prevent his son from becoming him. In the Santa Monica series, as in Greek mythology, the gods’ fathers are overthrown by their children, and Kratos has already felt the consequences of his actions, dealing with his own anger and thirst for violence. Where have we seen this rabid behavior in search of revenge? Well, surprise, in Star Wars. Darth Vader succumbed to the dark side of the force as well as the quality of the films in episode I, II and III. Luke was close to following his father’s path, but with the help of his mentors and friends he had enough strength to resist.

Kratos is the brute with difficulties in coping with his feelings and his son, but the character has grown and gained a lot of depth. Atreus is amazing, in addition to being well written brings welcome additions and mechanics in the gameplay of the game. The new God of War continues to be a good action game, and received the 2018 Game of the Year from The Video Game Awards.

In 2009, he worked briefly at the now closed LucasArts, which is when he got in touch with the TV series.

The latest God of War focuses more on human relations than in the past, since the previous games of the series were limited to kill everything while Kratos continuously shouts. Although he was an absent father, he must now take care of his son, raised practically alone by his mother. Kratos is rethinking his life, trying to prevent his son from becoming him. In the Santa Monica series, as in Greek mythology, the gods’ fathers are overthrown by their children, and Kratos has already felt the consequences of his actions, dealing with his own anger and thirst for violence. Where have we seen this rabid behavior in search of revenge? Well, surprise, in Star Wars. Darth Vader succumbed to the dark side of the force as well as the quality of the films in episode I, II and III. Luke was close to following his father’s path, but with the help of his mentors and friends he had enough strength to resist.

Kratos is the brute with difficulties in coping with his feelings and his son, but the character has grown and gained a lot of depth. Atreus is amazing, in addition to being well written brings welcome additions and mechanics in the gameplay of the game. The new God of War continues to be a good action game, and received the 2018 Game of the Year from The Video Game Awards.

trail.content_raw:
The two original Star Wars trilogies were about the Skywalker family. Their relationships, their mistakes, the tormenting past and their eventual redemption. In this sense, God of War is like Star Wars with mythological gods.

That is something positive. Human fictions that resist time are precisely those that touched us, those that excite us, after all, the intellectual capacity, together with that of understanding our feelings, is what sets us apart from our younger animal brothers.

Many stories follow a similar archetype, but archetypes exist precisely because we empathize with them, we are moved by the story of the characters. If we would analyze the earliest origins of this type of story, we will discover, in the midst of fiction, at least a little truth, real facts arising from life.

The creative director of the latest God of War, Cory Barlog, said he was influenced by a canceled TV series of Star Wars when creating the latest God of War. The series would show how the Emperor became the villain. Barlog was the lead animator on the first God of War and the director for God of War II. He started as the director of God of War III, but left developer Sony Santa Monica during its development. In 2009, he worked briefly at the now closed LucasArts, which is when he got in touch with the TV series.

The latest God of War focuses more on human relations than in the past, since the previous games of the series were limited to kill everything while Kratos continuously shouts. Although he was an absent father, he must now take care of his son, raised practically alone by his mother. Kratos is rethinking his life, trying to prevent his son from becoming him. In the Santa Monica series, as in Greek mythology, the gods’ fathers are overthrown by their children, and Kratos has already felt the consequences of his actions, dealing with his own anger and thirst for violence. Where have we seen this rabid behavior in search of revenge? Well, surprise, in Star Wars. Darth Vader succumbed to the dark side of the force as well as the quality of the films in episode I, II and III. Luke was close to following his father’s path, but with the help of his mentors and friends he had enough strength to resist.

Kratos is the brute with difficulties in coping with his feelings and his son, but the character has grown and gained a lot of depth. Atreus is amazing, in addition to being well written brings welcome additions and mechanics in the gameplay of the game. The new God of War continues to be a good action game, and received the 2018 Game of the Year from The Video Game Awards.

je remercie tous ceux qui apprécient et soutiennent mon petit passe-temps!
